title: [Bug]: Windows build not working - teams-for-linux.exe is not valid Win32 application
body:
### Can you reproduce this bug in the website/PWA?

Not applicable

### Describe the bug

Windows build is not able to start and work under Windows 7. After starting of application, error "teams-for-linux.exe is not valid Win32 application" is reported and application closed.

### What package are you using?

Windows

### Version

2.0.12

### Reproduction steps

```markdown
1. Use Windows 7 Professional 64bit (Slovak language pack)
2. Download and install teams-for-linux exe
3. At the end of installation, error window appears with text "C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\teams-for-linux.lnk  |  Unknown error"
4. After starting application, error window appears with text "C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Programs\teams-for-linux\teams-for-linux.exe is not valid Win32 application." and application closes.

(please note - error messages are displayed in Slovak language, above is English translation of error messages).
```

### Expected Behavior

```markdown
It would be great if app could be used under Windows 7.
```

### Debug

```markdown
Starting team-for-linux.exe with --webDebug produces same error "teams-for-linux.exe is not valid Win32 application".
```

### Additional context

I have tried previous version 2.0.11 with the same result.
